definition: to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.chinese: 醜聞使這所學校名譽掃地。

sentences.english: The politician became bankrupt in reputation.
The reputation and future of a 19-year-old girl is on tenterhooks.
sentences.chinese: 一個只有19歲的女孩似乎就此名譽掃地。

sentences.english: She has described him as politically discredited.
sentences.chinese: 勒龐形容他政治名譽掃地。
